name: Ext_R5_SubstanceSourceMaterial
title: Cross-version Extension for R5.SubstanceSourceMaterial for use in FHIR R4
description: This cross-version extension represents SubstanceSourceMaterial from http://hl7.org/fhir/StructureDefinition/SubstanceSourceMaterial|5.0.0 for use in FHIR R4.

element.short: Source material shall capture information on the taxonomic and anatomical origins as well as the fraction of a material that can result in or can be modified to form a substance. This set of data elements shall be used to define polymer substances isolated from biological matrices. Taxonomic and anatomical origins shall be described using a controlled vocabulary as required. This information is captured for naturally derived polymers ( . starch) and structurally diverse substances. For Organisms belonging to the Kingdom Plantae the Substance level defines the fresh material of a single species or infraspecies, the Herbal Drug and the Herbal preparation. For Herbal preparations, the fraction information will be captured at the Substance information level and additional information for herbal extracts will be captured at the Specified Substance Group 1 information level. See for further explanation the Substance Class: Structurally Diverse and the herbal annex
element.definition: This cross-version extension represents SubstanceSourceMaterial from http://hl7.org/fhir/StructureDefinition/SubstanceSourceMaterial|5.0.0 for use in FHIR R4.

element.short: General high level classification of the source material specific to the origin of the material
element.definition: This cross-version extension represents SubstanceSourceMaterial.sourceMaterialClass from http://hl7.org/fhir/StructureDefinition/SubstanceSourceMaterial|5.0.0 for use in FHIR R4.

element.short: General high level classification of the source material specific to the origin of the material
element.definition: This cross-version extension represents SubstanceSourceMaterial.sourceMaterialClass from http://hl7.org/fhir/StructureDefinition/SubstanceSourceMaterial|5.0.0 for use in FHIR R4.

element.short: The type of the source material shall be specified based on a controlled vocabulary. For vaccines, this subclause refers to the class of infectious agent
element.definition: This cross-version extension represents SubstanceSourceMaterial.sourceMaterialType from http://hl7.org/fhir/StructureDefinition/SubstanceSourceMaterial|5.0.0 for use in FHIR R4.

element.short: The type of the source material shall be specified based on a controlled vocabulary. For vaccines, this subclause refers to the class of infectious agent
element.definition: This cross-version extension represents SubstanceSourceMaterial.sourceMaterialType from http://hl7.org/fhir/StructureDefinition/SubstanceSourceMaterial|5.0.0 for use in FHIR R4.

element.short: The state of the source material when extracted
element.definition: This cross-version extension represents SubstanceSourceMaterial.sourceMaterialState from http://hl7.org/fhir/StructureDefinition/SubstanceSourceMaterial|5.0.0 for use in FHIR R4.

element.short: The state of the source material when extracted
element.definition: This cross-version extension represents SubstanceSourceMaterial.sourceMaterialState from http://hl7.org/fhir/StructureDefinition/SubstanceSourceMaterial|5.0.0 for use in FHIR R4.

element.short: The unique identifier associated with the source material parent organism shall be specified
element.definition: This cross-version extension represents SubstanceSourceMaterial.organismId from http://hl7.org/fhir/StructureDefinition/SubstanceSourceMaterial|5.0.0 for use in FHIR R4.

element.short: The unique identifier associated with the source material parent organism shall be specified
element.definition: This cross-version extension represents SubstanceSourceMaterial.organismId from http://hl7.org/fhir/StructureDefinition/SubstanceSourceMaterial|5.0.0 for use in FHIR R4.

element.short: The organism accepted Scientific name shall be provided based on the organism taxonomy
element.definition: This cross-version extension represents SubstanceSourceMaterial.organismName from http://hl7.org/fhir/StructureDefinition/SubstanceSourceMaterial|5.0.0 for use in FHIR R4.

element.short: The organism accepted Scientific name shall be provided based on the organism taxonomy
element.definition: This cross-version extension represents SubstanceSourceMaterial.organismName from http://hl7.org/fhir/StructureDefinition/SubstanceSourceMaterial|5.0.0 for use in FHIR R4.

element.short: The parent of the herbal drug Ginkgo biloba, Leaf is the substance ID of the substance (fresh) of Ginkgo biloba L. or Ginkgo biloba L. (Whole plant)
element.definition: This cross-version extension represents SubstanceSourceMaterial.parentSubstanceId from http://hl7.org/fhir/StructureDefinition/SubstanceSourceMaterial|5.0.0 for use in FHIR R4.

element.short: The parent of the herbal drug Ginkgo biloba, Leaf is the substance ID of the substance (fresh) of Ginkgo biloba L. or Ginkgo biloba L. (Whole plant)
element.definition: This cross-version extension represents SubstanceSourceMaterial.parentSubstanceId from http://hl7.org/fhir/StructureDefinition/SubstanceSourceMaterial|5.0.0 for use in FHIR R4.

element.short: The parent substance of the Herbal Drug, or Herbal preparation
element.definition: This cross-version extension represents SubstanceSourceMaterial.parentSubstanceName from http://hl7.org/fhir/StructureDefinition/SubstanceSourceMaterial|5.0.0 for use in FHIR R4.

element.short: The parent substance of the Herbal Drug, or Herbal preparation
element.definition: This cross-version extension represents SubstanceSourceMaterial.parentSubstanceName from http://hl7.org/fhir/StructureDefinition/SubstanceSourceMaterial|5.0.0 for use in FHIR R4.

element.short: The country where the plant material is harvested or the countries where the plasma is sourced from as laid down in accordance with the Plasma Master File. For “Plasma-derived substances” the attribute country of origin provides information about the countries used for the manufacturing of the Cryopoor plama or Crioprecipitate
element.definition: This cross-version extension represents SubstanceSourceMaterial.countryOfOrigin from http://hl7.org/fhir/StructureDefinition/SubstanceSourceMaterial|5.0.0 for use in FHIR R4.

element.short: The country where the plant material is harvested or the countries where the plasma is sourced from as laid down in accordance with the Plasma Master File. For “Plasma-derived substances” the attribute country of origin provides information about the countries used for the manufacturing of the Cryopoor plama or Crioprecipitate
element.definition: This cross-version extension represents SubstanceSourceMaterial.countryOfOrigin from http://hl7.org/fhir/StructureDefinition/SubstanceSourceMaterial|5.0.0 for use in FHIR R4.

element.short: The place/region where the plant is harvested or the places/regions where the animal source material has its habitat
element.definition: This cross-version extension represents SubstanceSourceMaterial.geographicalLocation from http://hl7.org/fhir/StructureDefinition/SubstanceSourceMaterial|5.0.0 for use in FHIR R4.

element.short: The place/region where the plant is harvested or the places/regions where the animal source material has its habitat
element.definition: This cross-version extension represents SubstanceSourceMaterial.geographicalLocation from http://hl7.org/fhir/StructureDefinition/SubstanceSourceMaterial|5.0.0 for use in FHIR R4.

element.short: Stage of life for animals, plants, insects and microorganisms. This information shall be provided only when the substance is significantly different in these stages (e.g. foetal bovine serum)
element.definition: This cross-version extension represents SubstanceSourceMaterial.developmentStage from http://hl7.org/fhir/StructureDefinition/SubstanceSourceMaterial|5.0.0 for use in FHIR R4.

element.short: Stage of life for animals, plants, insects and microorganisms. This information shall be provided only when the substance is significantly different in these stages (e.g. foetal bovine serum)
element.definition: This cross-version extension represents SubstanceSourceMaterial.developmentStage from http://hl7.org/fhir/StructureDefinition/SubstanceSourceMaterial|5.0.0 for use in FHIR R4.

element.short: Many complex materials are fractions of parts of plants, animals, or minerals. Fraction elements are often necessary to define both Substances and Specified Group 1 Substances. For substances derived from Plants, fraction information will be captured at the Substance information level ( . Oils, Juices and Exudates). Additional information for Extracts, such as extraction solvent composition, will be captured at the Specified Substance Group 1 information level. For plasma-derived products fraction information will be captured at the Substance and the Specified Substance Group 1 levels
element.definition: This cross-version extension represents SubstanceSourceMaterial.fractionDescription from http://hl7.org/fhir/StructureDefinition/SubstanceSourceMaterial|5.0.0 for use in FHIR R4.

element.short: This element is capturing information about the fraction of a plant part, or human plasma for fractionation
element.definition: This cross-version extension represents SubstanceSourceMaterial.fractionDescription.fraction from http://hl7.org/fhir/StructureDefinition/SubstanceSourceMaterial|5.0.0 for use in FHIR R4.

element.short: This element is capturing information about the fraction of a plant part, or human plasma for fractionation
element.definition: This cross-version extension represents SubstanceSourceMaterial.fractionDescription.fraction from http://hl7.org/fhir/StructureDefinition/SubstanceSourceMaterial|5.0.0 for use in FHIR R4.

element.short: The specific type of the material constituting the component. For Herbal preparations the particulars of the extracts (liquid/dry) is described in Specified Substance Group 1
element.definition: This cross-version extension represents SubstanceSourceMaterial.fractionDescription.materialType from http://hl7.org/fhir/StructureDefinition/SubstanceSourceMaterial|5.0.0 for use in FHIR R4.

element.short: The specific type of the material constituting the component. For Herbal preparations the particulars of the extracts (liquid/dry) is described in Specified Substance Group 1
element.definition: This cross-version extension represents SubstanceSourceMaterial.fractionDescription.materialType from http://hl7.org/fhir/StructureDefinition/SubstanceSourceMaterial|5.0.0 for use in FHIR R4.

element.short: This subclause describes the organism which the substance is derived from. For vaccines, the parent organism shall be specified based on these subclause elements. As an example, full taxonomy will be described for the Substance Name: ., Leaf
element.definition: This cross-version extension represents SubstanceSourceMaterial.organism from http://hl7.org/fhir/StructureDefinition/SubstanceSourceMaterial|5.0.0 for use in FHIR R4.

element.short: The family of an organism shall be specified
element.definition: This cross-version extension represents SubstanceSourceMaterial.organism.family from http://hl7.org/fhir/StructureDefinition/SubstanceSourceMaterial|5.0.0 for use in FHIR R4.

element.short: The family of an organism shall be specified
element.definition: This cross-version extension represents SubstanceSourceMaterial.organism.family from http://hl7.org/fhir/StructureDefinition/SubstanceSourceMaterial|5.0.0 for use in FHIR R4.

element.short: The genus of an organism shall be specified; refers to the Latin epithet of the genus element of the plant/animal scientific name; it is present in names for genera, species and infraspecies
element.definition: This cross-version extension represents SubstanceSourceMaterial.organism.genus from http://hl7.org/fhir/StructureDefinition/SubstanceSourceMaterial|5.0.0 for use in FHIR R4.

element.short: The genus of an organism shall be specified; refers to the Latin epithet of the genus element of the plant/animal scientific name; it is present in names for genera, species and infraspecies
element.definition: This cross-version extension represents SubstanceSourceMaterial.organism.genus from http://hl7.org/fhir/StructureDefinition/SubstanceSourceMaterial|5.0.0 for use in FHIR R4.

element.short: The species of an organism shall be specified; refers to the Latin epithet of the species of the plant/animal; it is present in names for species and infraspecies
element.definition: This cross-version extension represents SubstanceSourceMaterial.organism.species from http://hl7.org/fhir/StructureDefinition/SubstanceSourceMaterial|5.0.0 for use in FHIR R4.

element.short: The species of an organism shall be specified; refers to the Latin epithet of the species of the plant/animal; it is present in names for species and infraspecies
element.definition: This cross-version extension represents SubstanceSourceMaterial.organism.species from http://hl7.org/fhir/StructureDefinition/SubstanceSourceMaterial|5.0.0 for use in FHIR R4.

element.short: The Intraspecific type of an organism shall be specified
element.definition: This cross-version extension represents SubstanceSourceMaterial.organism.intraspecificType from http://hl7.org/fhir/StructureDefinition/SubstanceSourceMaterial|5.0.0 for use in FHIR R4.

element.short: The Intraspecific type of an organism shall be specified
element.definition: This cross-version extension represents SubstanceSourceMaterial.organism.intraspecificType from http://hl7.org/fhir/StructureDefinition/SubstanceSourceMaterial|5.0.0 for use in FHIR R4.

element.short: The intraspecific description of an organism shall be specified based on a controlled vocabulary. For Influenza Vaccine, the intraspecific description shall contain the syntax of the antigen in line with the WHO convention
element.definition: This cross-version extension represents SubstanceSourceMaterial.organism.intraspecificDescription from http://hl7.org/fhir/StructureDefinition/SubstanceSourceMaterial|5.0.0 for use in FHIR R4.

element.short: The intraspecific description of an organism shall be specified based on a controlled vocabulary. For Influenza Vaccine, the intraspecific description shall contain the syntax of the antigen in line with the WHO convention
element.definition: This cross-version extension represents SubstanceSourceMaterial.organism.intraspecificDescription from http://hl7.org/fhir/StructureDefinition/SubstanceSourceMaterial|5.0.0 for use in FHIR R4.

element.short: 4.9.13.6.1 Author type (Conditional)
element.definition: This cross-version extension represents SubstanceSourceMaterial.organism.author from http://hl7.org/fhir/StructureDefinition/SubstanceSourceMaterial|5.0.0 for use in FHIR R4.

element.short: The type of author of an organism species shall be specified. The parenthetical author of an organism species refers to the first author who published the plant/animal name (of any rank). The primary author of an organism species refers to the first author(s), who validly published the plant/animal name
element.definition: This cross-version extension represents SubstanceSourceMaterial.organism.author.authorType from http://hl7.org/fhir/StructureDefinition/SubstanceSourceMaterial|5.0.0 for use in FHIR R4.

element.short: The type of author of an organism species shall be specified. The parenthetical author of an organism species refers to the first author who published the plant/animal name (of any rank). The primary author of an organism species refers to the first author(s), who validly published the plant/animal name
element.definition: This cross-version extension represents SubstanceSourceMaterial.organism.author.authorType from http://hl7.org/fhir/StructureDefinition/SubstanceSourceMaterial|5.0.0 for use in FHIR R4.

element.short: The author of an organism species shall be specified. The author year of an organism shall also be specified when applicable; refers to the year in which the first author(s) published the infraspecific plant/animal name (of any rank)
element.definition: This cross-version extension represents SubstanceSourceMaterial.organism.author.authorDescription from http://hl7.org/fhir/StructureDefinition/SubstanceSourceMaterial|5.0.0 for use in FHIR R4.

element.short: The author of an organism species shall be specified. The author year of an organism shall also be specified when applicable; refers to the year in which the first author(s) published the infraspecific plant/animal name (of any rank)
element.definition: This cross-version extension represents SubstanceSourceMaterial.organism.author.authorDescription from http://hl7.org/fhir/StructureDefinition/SubstanceSourceMaterial|5.0.0 for use in FHIR R4.

element.short: 4.9.13.8.1 Hybrid species maternal organism ID (Optional)

element.short: The identifier of the maternal species constituting the hybrid organism shall be specified based on a controlled vocabulary. For plants, the parents aren’t always known, and it is unlikely that it will be known which is maternal and which is paternal
element.definition: This cross-version extension represents SubstanceSourceMaterial.organism.hybrid.maternalOrganismId from http://hl7.org/fhir/StructureDefinition/SubstanceSourceMaterial|5.0.0 for use in FHIR R4.

element.definition: This cross-version extension represents SubstanceSourceMaterial.organism.hybrid.paternalOrganismId from http://hl7.org/fhir/StructureDefinition/SubstanceSourceMaterial|5.0.0 for use in FHIR R4.

element.definition: This cross-version extension represents SubstanceSourceMaterial.organism.hybrid.paternalOrganismId from http://hl7.org/fhir/StructureDefinition/SubstanceSourceMaterial|5.0.0 for use in FHIR R4.

element.definition: This cross-version extension represents SubstanceSourceMaterial.organism.hybrid.paternalOrganismName from http://hl7.org/fhir/StructureDefinition/SubstanceSourceMaterial|5.0.0 for use in FHIR R4.

element.short: The name of the paternal species constituting the hybrid organism shall be specified
element.definition: This cross-version extension represents SubstanceSourceMaterial.organism.hybrid.paternalOrganismName from http://hl7.org/fhir/StructureDefinition/SubstanceSourceMaterial|5.0.0 for use in FHIR R4.

element.short: The hybrid type of an organism shall be specified
element.definition: This cross-version extension represents SubstanceSourceMaterial.organism.hybrid.hybridType from http://hl7.org/fhir/StructureDefinition/SubstanceSourceMaterial|5.0.0 for use in FHIR R4.

element.short: The hybrid type of an organism shall be specified
element.definition: This cross-version extension represents SubstanceSourceMaterial.organism.hybrid.hybridType from http://hl7.org/fhir/StructureDefinition/SubstanceSourceMaterial|5.0.0 for use in FHIR R4.

element.definition: This cross-version extension represents SubstanceSourceMaterial.organism.organismGeneral.phylum from http://hl7.org/fhir/StructureDefinition/SubstanceSourceMaterial|5.0.0 for use in FHIR R4.

element.short: The class of an organism shall be specified
element.definition: This cross-version extension represents SubstanceSourceMaterial.organism.organismGeneral.class from http://hl7.org/fhir/StructureDefinition/SubstanceSourceMaterial|5.0.0 for use in FHIR R4.

element.definition: This cross-version extension represents SubstanceSourceMaterial.organism.organismGeneral.class from http://hl7.org/fhir/StructureDefinition/SubstanceSourceMaterial|5.0.0 for use in FHIR R4.

element.short: The order of an organism shall be specified,
element.definition: This cross-version extension represents SubstanceSourceMaterial.organism.organismGeneral.order from http://hl7.org/fhir/StructureDefinition/SubstanceSourceMaterial|5.0.0 for use in FHIR R4.

element.short: The order of an organism shall be specified,

element.short: To do
element.definition: This cross-version extension represents SubstanceSourceMaterial.partDescription from http://hl7.org/fhir/StructureDefinition/SubstanceSourceMaterial|5.0.0 for use in FHIR R4.

element.short: Entity of anatomical origin of source material within an organism
element.definition: This cross-version extension represents SubstanceSourceMaterial.partDescription.part from http://hl7.org/fhir/StructureDefinition/SubstanceSourceMaterial|5.0.0 for use in FHIR R4.

element.short: The detailed anatomic location when the part can be extracted from different anatomical locations of the organism. Multiple alternative locations may apply
